Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can draw a plant with leaves and a stem to show what a healthy, growing plant looks like, with realistic details.
The student can draw and label the sun correctly to show that plants need light to live and grow, possibly including details like sun rays.
The student can draw water accurately, such as raindrops or a watering can, to show that plants need water to live and grow.
The student can draw a plant that does not look healthy, with clear signs like wilted or droopy leaves when it does not have light, effectively showing lack of health.
The student can draw a plant that does not look healthy, with detailed signs like wilted or droopy leaves when it does not have water, illustrating the negative effect of lack of resources.
CANNOT: Occasionally, the student may forget to label all elements, such as the types of water sources (e.g., raindrops vs. a watering can) *(minor oversight, despite understanding)*.

The student might inconsistently show the exact causes of plant health or lack thereof, such as not always directly connecting wilted plants to the absence of water or light *(minor gap due to natural variation)*.
